00042 #  define MSQ_FUNCTION ""

00052 #define MSQ_CHKERR(err)  (err.error() && err.push(MSQ_FUNCTION,__FILE__,__LINE__))
00053 
00058 #define MSQ_ERRRTN(err)  if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return
00059 
00062 #define MSQ_ERRZERO(err)  if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return 0
00063 
00066 #define MSQ_ERRFALSE(err)  if (MSQ_CHKERR(err)) return false
00067 
00077 #define MSQ_SETERR(err) \
00078 Mesquite::MsqError::setter(err, MSQ_FUNCTION,__FILE__,__LINE__).set

00100 class MsqError {
00101 public:
00102 
00103     /* NOTE: If you add an error to this list, make sure
00104        a) you add it *before* LAST_ERROR_CODE
00105        b) you add the corresponding string in MsqError.cpp
00106      */
00109   enum ErrorCode {
00110     NO_ERROR          =  0,
00111     UNKNOWN_ERROR,         
00112     OUT_OF_MEMORY,         
00113     INVALID_ARG ,          
00114     NOT_INITIALIZED,       
00115     INVALID_STATE,         
00116     FILE_ACCESS,           
00117     FILE_FORMAT,           
00118     PARSE_ERROR,           
00119     IO_ERROR,              
00120     INVALID_MESH,          
00121     NO_PD_STORAGE_MODE,    
00122     NOT_IMPLEMENTED,       
00123     INTERNAL_ERROR,        
00124     INTERRUPTED,           
00125     TAG_ALREADY_EXISTS,    
00126     TAG_NOT_FOUND,         
00127     UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT,   
00128     PARALLEL_ERROR,        
00129     LAST_ERROR_CODE
00130   };
00131   
00133   MESQUITE_EXPORT void clear(); 
00134   
00136   inline bool error() const       { return NO_ERROR != errorCode; }
00138   inline operator bool() const    { return NO_ERROR != errorCode; }
00139 
00141   MESQUITE_EXPORT MsqError() : errorCode(NO_ERROR) { } 
00142   
00144   MESQUITE_EXPORT virtual ~MsqError();
00145 
00146  /* ************************************************************ *
00147   *            Low-level access to error data
00148   * ************************************************************ */  
00149 
00151   inline ErrorCode error_code() const    { return errorCode; }
00152 
00155   struct MESQUITE_EXPORT Trace {
00156     std::string function;
00157     std::string file;
00158     int line;
00159     
00160     Trace( const char* fun, const char* fil, int lin )
00161      : function(fun), file(fil), line(lin) {}
00162   };
00163   
00165   MESQUITE_EXPORT const char* error_message() const;
00166   
00169   typedef std::list<Trace> StackTrace;
00170 
00172   inline const StackTrace& stack() const { return stackTrace; }
00173 
00174 
00175  /* ************************************************************ *
00176   *                        Set error data
00177   * ************************************************************ */  
00178   
00181   MESQUITE_EXPORT virtual bool push( const char* function, const char* file, int line );
00182   
00184   MESQUITE_EXPORT virtual bool set_error( ErrorCode num, const char* msg = 0 );
00185   
00189   class MESQUITE_EXPORT Setter {
00190     public:
00191       Setter(MsqError& err, const char* function, const char* file, int line) 
00192         : mErr(err), functionName(function), fileName(file), lineNumber(line) {}
00193       
00194       bool set( ErrorCode num );
00195       bool set( const char* message, ErrorCode num );
00196       bool set( const std::string& message, ErrorCode num );
00197       bool set( ErrorCode num, const char* format, ... )
00198       #ifdef __GNUC__
00199         __attribute__ ((format (printf, 3, 4)))
00200       #endif
00201         ; // ending semicolon for set( ErrorCode num, const char* format, ... )
00202     private:
00203       MsqError& mErr;
00204       const char* functionName;
00205       const char* fileName;
00206       int lineNumber;
00207   };
00208 
00209   static inline Setter setter( MsqError& err, const char* function, const char* file, int line )
00210   { return Setter( err, function, file, line ); }
00211
